intro: Gifola, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruit, a globose berry, changes color from green to red as it matures. Gifola is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
